snippet: The failure to file plans was a setback to President Obama’s hopes that Republicans would join a campaign to provide health insurance to all Americans.
abstract: More than half of America's states have rejected federal government's pleas to set up their own health insurance exchanges; action is setback to Pres Obama’s hopes that Republicans would join White House campaign to provide health insurance to all Americans.
lead_paragraph: The failure to file plans was a setback to President Obama’s hopes that Republicans would join a campaign to provide health insurance to all Americans.

headline.main: Most Governors Refuse to Set Up Health Exchanges
headline.print_headline: Majority of Governors Refuse To Set Up Health Exchanges

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
